intro: Tithymalus austroanatolicus, commonly known as the Anatolian tithymalus, is a flowering plant native to the Anatolian region of Turkey. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils and is adapted to the Mediterranean climate of its native habitat. Its botanical features include finely divided leaves and a compact growth habit, making it a distinctive member of its genus. Tithymalus austroanatolicus is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique ecological niche.
